com.businessglue.struts
Class FileAction

java.lang.Object
  org.apache.struts.action.Action
      com.businessglue.struts.FileAction
public class FileAction
extends org.apache.struts.action.Action

This class retieves a filename from the header, parses puts it in a FileBean and puts the bean in the session scope.

Workarounds include, path obtained by dubious methods (done in LoginAction), and file_name retrieved by parsing header, and not request.getHeader("filename")which returns null.

Took out the file_bean attribute words_defs because it caused problems later with a class cast exception.

Method Detail

perform

public org.apache.struts.action.ActionForward perform(org.apache.struts.action.ActionMapping mapping,
                                                      org.apache.struts.action.ActionForm form,
                                                      javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request,
                                                      javax.servlet.http.HttpServletResponse response)

This class is responsable for deciding what kind of file has been chosen, and where to send the control to next. The user_bean should be set with any data that will be needed later.

Currently there is a little confusion here which should be made more consitent. Previously we send control only to the file.jsp, but with more actions required, we started to go to different jsp's. This has been remedied somewhat so far. Check it out.

catAction

private void catAction()

xmlAction

private void xmlAction()

checkTypeAction

private void checkTypeAction()

IF file has a previous extension, such as file.list.txt, we want to find the previous extension and act accordingly in this method.

Currently, the .list extension will be a plain text file of a list of comma seperated words.

If there is no extension, file_second_type will be returned as -1, and will default to txtAction anyway.
